alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lawrence (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 12:44PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Franklin and southwestern Lawrence Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1241 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms from east of the Phil Campbell area to north of Brushy Lake in southern Lawrence county. These storms are nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and very heavy rainfall is occurring in these areas. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects and heavy rainfall could produce ponding on area roadways and very localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Bankhead National Forest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
